papers.title: Effective field theory for weakly bound two-neutron halo nuclei: Corrections from neutron-neutron effective range
papers.authors: Davi B. Costa, Masaru Hongo, and Dam Thanh Son
papers.summary: Author(s): Davi B. Costa, Masaru Hongo, and Dam Thanh SonUsing an effective field-theoretical approach, we investigate the properties of weakly bound two-neutron halo nuclei (also known as Borromean nuclei) that do not support a low-energy $s$-wave core-neutron resonance. Extending the recently formulated effective field theory for weakly bound Borromean …[Phys. Rev. C 112, 014001] Published Mon Jul 07, 2025

papers.title: Machine learning approach to trapped many-fermion systems
papers.authors: Paulo F. Bedaque, Hersh Kumar, and Andy Sheng
papers.summary: Author(s): Paulo F. Bedaque, Hersh Kumar, and Andy ShengWe apply a variational ansatz based on neural networks to the problem of spin-$\frac{1}{2}$ fermions in a harmonic trap interacting through a short distance potential. We showed that standard machine learning techniques lead to a quick convergence to the ground state, especially in weakly coupled ca…[Phys. Rev. C 112, 014002] Published Mon Jul 07, 2025

papers.title: Coulomb excitation of $^{80}\mathrm{Sr}$ and the limits of the $N≈Z≈40$ island of deformation
papers.summary: Author(s): R. Russell et al.The region of $N≈Z≈40$ has long been associated with strongly deformed nuclear configurations. The presence of this strong deformation was recently confirmed through lifetime measurements in $N≈Z$ Sr and Zr nuclei. Theoretically, however, these nuclei present a challenge due to the vast valence spac…[Phys. Rev. C 112, 014309] Published Mon Jul 07, 2025

Considerable discrepancies—reaching 20%—exist between evaluations in the unresolved-resonance region. Furthermore, e…[Phys. Rev. C 112, 014612] Published Mon Jul 07, 2025

papers.title: Effect of $N/Z$ asymmetry on pre-equilibrium and equilibrium emission of light charged particles
papers.authors: S. Manna, Pratap Roy, T. K. Rana, S. Kundu, R. Pandey, K. Banerjee, A. Sen, T. K. Ghosh, G. Mukherjee, S. Mukhopadhyay, P. Karmakar, D. Paul, S. Dalal, and C. Bhattacharya

Rev. C 112, 014613] Published Mon Jul 07, 2025

papers.title: Meson spin alignment and baryon polarization from coalescence with spin-vorticity nonequilibrium
papers.authors: Kayman J. Gonçalves, Giorgio Torrieri, and Radoslaw Ryblewski
papers.summary: Author(s): Kayman J. Gonçalves, Giorgio Torrieri, and Radoslaw RyblewskiWe estimate both the polarization of spin $1/2$ baryons and the spin density matrix coefficients of spin 1 mesons using a thermal model that incorporates vorticity and polarization to describe quarks, along with a coalescence formalism where spin and vorticity are not in equilibrium. We find that wh…[Phys. Rev. C 112, 014901] Published Mon Jul 07, 2025

papers.title: Decay behavior of hidden-strange hadronic molecular state $N(2270)$
papers.summary: Author(s): Di Ben and Shu-Ming WuWe systematically discuss the decay patterns of the hidden-strange hadronic molecular state $N(2270)$ which is assumed to be an $s$-wave ${K}^{*}{\mathrm{Σ}}^{*}$ shallow bound state with possible quantum numbers ${J}^{P}$ of ${1/2}^{−}, {3/2}^{−}$, and ${5/2}^{−}$. By using the effective Lagrangian…[Phys. Rev. C 112, 015203] Published Mon Jul 07, 2025
